section.heading: Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice.
section.text: In compliance with Business Occupations and Professions Article, §16-208(b), Annotated Code of Maryland, the Commission adopts the most recent version of the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice (The Appraisal Foundation), including Preamble, Ethics Rule, Competency Rule, Scope of Work Rule, Jurisdictional Exception, Supplemental Standards, Definitions and Standards 1, 2, 3, and 4 with all related Standard Rules and Statements on Appraisal Standards, as it may be amended, modified, or updated from time to time.

section.heading: Compliance with State Law.
section.text: While performing an appraisal, licensed and certified appraisers shall abide by each provision of the Maryland Real Estate Appraisers Act, Business Occupations and Professions Article, §16-101 et seq., Annotated Code of Maryland, including each provision of §16-701.

section.heading: Responsibilities of Licensees and Certificate Holders.

para.text: A licensee or certificate holder shall respond to the Commission in writing within 30 days of receipt of a written communication from the Commission to the licensee or certificate holder.
The Commission shall send written communications by certified and first class mail to the last address furnished to the Commission by the licensee or certificate holder.

annotations.annotation: Business Occupations and Professions Article, §§16-208, 16-216, 16-220, 16-302(d) and (g), and 16-503(b) and (f), Annotated Code of Maryland
